Metaphor:POVERTY IS A DISEASE

From EN MetaNet Wiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Name Gloss POVERTY IS A DISEASE
Name Transcription
Aliases

POVERTY IS AN ILLNESS

POVERTY IS A PHYSICAL AFFLICTION

Description e.g. "epidemic of poverty"
Comments Right now, it is not worth while to distinguish between POVERTY as a DISEASE, ILLNESS, or PHYSICAL AFFLICTION, even though we do have these distinctions in the frame network. For now, POVERTY IS A DISEASE is a cover for all metaphors using any of these source frames.

Cultural scope checked for Persian--Aria

Tags
Family Poverty metaphors, Physical afflictions metaphors, Disease metaphors, Poverty as a social problem metaphors
Metaphor Level
Metaphor Type Composed/complex
Experiential Basis
Cultural Scope Persian, American English
Source Frame Disease
Roles:disease, patient, symptom, body_part, infection_process, health_state
Target Frame Poverty
Roles:amount of resources, cause_of_impoverished_state, impoverished_entity, impoverished_state, degree of poverty


Mappings:

impoverished_entity <= patient
impoverished_state <= disease

Related Metaphors:

Current Metaphor POVERTY IS A DISEASE
Relation Type is a target subcase of
Related Metaphor SOCIAL PROBLEMS ARE DISEASES
Description
Current Metaphor POVERTY IS A DISEASE
Relation Type is a source subcase of
Related Metaphor POVERTY IS PHYSICAL HARM
Description

Entailments:


Examples:

Example Text: The epidemic of poverty is spreading in America, and it's taking its toll on American families.
Transcription:
English Translation:
Provenance: http://www.americanprogress.org/issues/poverty/news/2007/04/24/2923/the-poverty-epidemic-in-america-by-the-numbers/
Annotation:
Comments:
Example Text: As President Obama has said, we can't treat the symptoms of poverty in isolation.
Transcription:
English Translation:
Provenance: http://portal.hud.gov/hudportal/HUD?src=/press/speeches_remarks_statements/2013/Speech_091713
Annotation:
Comments:
